author: Ben Otto
title: Indonesia Digs In to Grab a Bigger Share of Its Resource Wealth
text:
JAKARTA, Indonesiaâ€”Indonesia is trying to capture a bigger share of the vast wealth from its natural resources by seeking more favorable deals and building state-owned firms into industrial behemoths, a strategy that risks alienating foreign investors and has already spookedFreeport-McMoRan Inc. shareholders.
President Joko Widodo is attempting to seal an agreement that would give a majority stake in the mountaintop Grasberg mine in eastern Indonesia to the government. Phoenix-based Freeport agreed to give up majority control...
